page.title: 08A DOCTOR'S LIFE SWANAGE
page.content: My Dad is G.P. in Swanage. He starts his day at 7.00am by going to mass. At 8.00am he goes to the Cottage Hospital to see his hospital patients. He then goes to the Health Centre and does his morning surgery. He sees about 20 people with tummy aches, sore thoats, bad chests and many other problems. After morning surgery he makes house calls to all the people who are too ill to go to the Health Centre. He then dashes home for some lunch. Most afternoons he makes more home visits. He takes evening surgery at 4.30pm On Tuesdays he spends all day at the Cottage Hospital operating. On Wednesdays he sees all the pregnant mothers. In the summer he has an extra surgery to see all the holiday makers who are taken ill during their holidays.
